interfaceSelectors.description: List of match expressions that must all match a single interface

RouteStatusState.description:
- ROUTE_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Route in this region is in an undefined state
 - RUNNING: Route has 1 or more assigned gateways and is correctly configured in this region
 - NO_GATEWAY: Route does not have any assigned gateways but is configured in this region
 - DELETING: Route is being deleted from the region

rootSubnet.description: The network's primary subnet, in CIDR notation format

ipFamilies.description: IPFamilies of IPs which will be assigned to network interface

networkCreateNetworkResponse.description: A response from a request to create a network

networkCreateRouteResponse.description: A response from a request to create a route on a network

networkGetRouteResponse.description: A response to retrieve an individual route on a network

networkGetRoutesResponse.description: A response to retrieve any routes on a given network

key.description:
The name of the selector to perform a match against

Provide the key `workload.platform.stackpath.net/workload-slug` to select EdgeCompute workloads by their slug. All network interfaces in the workload are used as the route's gateway.

operator.description:
The operation to perform to match a selector

Valid values are "in" with support for more possible in the future

values.description: The values to match in the selector

networkMatchExpression.description: An expression to match selectors against a set of values

createdAt.description: The date that a metadata entry was created

updatedAt.description: The date that a metadata entry was last updated

deleteRequestedAt.description: The date that an entity was requested for deletion

version.description:
An entity's version number

Versions start at 1 when they are created and increment by 1 every time they are updated.

rootSubnet.description:
A subnet identifier and network mask in CIDR notation format

A network's root subnet is its primary subnet.

stackId.description: The ID of the stack that a network belongs to

networkNetwork.description: A network defined within a Virtual Private Cloud

stackId.description: The ID of the stack that a route belongs to

networkId.description: The ID or slug of the VPC network that a route belongs to

statuses.description: The status of a route in different regions

destinationPrefixes.description: A route's destination network prefix, in CIDR format

gatewaySelectors.description:
Selectors that determine which EdgeCompute workload network interfaces should be be used as the route's gateway

Selectors are applied to the route in order, with the highest priority assigned to the first gateway.

region.description:
The region in which a route's status resides

Regions take the form `<pop name>-<cluster name>`, where `pop` is a StackPath EdgeCompute POP and `cluster` is a networking cluster within that POP.

gatewayIps.description: A list of route gateway IPs in the region

networkStringMapEntry.description: A string to string key/value pair

networkUpdateNetworkResponse.description: A response from a request to update a network

networkUpdateRouteResponse.description: A response from an update to a route on a network

totalCount.description: The total number of items in the dataset

hasPreviousPage.description: Whether or not a previous page of data exists

hasNextPage.description: Whether or not another page of data is available

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the set of data returned

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the set of data returned

paginationPageInfo.description:
Information about a paginated response

This is modeled after the GraphQL Relay spec to support both cursor based pagination and traditional offset based pagination.

v1CreateNetworkPolicyResponse.description: A response from a request to add a network policy to a stack

description.description: Detailed summary of what the egress rule does

v1Egress.description: An outbound rule from workload instances

v1GetNetworkPoliciesResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a stack's network policies

v1GetNetworkPolicyResponse.description: A response from a request to get a network policy to a stack

description.description: Detailed summary of what the ingress rule does

v1Ingress.description: An inbound rule to workload instances

cidr.description: A subnet that will define all the IPs allowed by a rule

except.description:
A list of subnets that will be excluded from the above subnet

This allows a convenient way to allow multiple ip ranges in a single expression

stackId.description: The ID of the stack that a network policy belongs to

name.description: A network policy's name as it appears in the StackPath portal

slug.description:
A network policy's programmatic name

Network policy slugs are used to build its instances names

description.description: Detailed summary of what the policy does

v1NetworkPolicy.description:
A network policy

Network policies define an ACL that applies to one or many workload instances

instanceSelectors.description: A selector to match workload instances

policyTypes.description:
A list of policy types

Policy types are used to specify what rules will be defined. If a policy type is given but not defined it will default. If it is not provided then no action will be used.

priority.description:
A policy's priority among other network policies. 1 - 65000

Network policies apply to all compute workloads on the stack. Lower values have a higher priority, and priorities must be unique across the stack. Use the special value 65534 to apply the same priority to different workload instances in the same stack, identified by their selectors.

ingress.description:
A list of rules for inbound traffic to instances

If the ingress policy type is given but not defined here the default is to block all

egress.description:
A list of rules for outbound traffic from instances

If the egress policy type is given but not defined here the default is to allow all

v1NetworkPolicySpec.description: The specification for the desired state of a network policy

destinationPorts.description: List of destination ports to allow 1-65535

sourcePorts.description: List of source ports to allow 1-65535, defaults to 1000-65535

destinationPorts.description: List of destination ports to allow 1-65535

sourcePorts.description: List of source ports to allow 1-65535, defaults to 1000-65535

v1ProtocolTcpUdp.description: TCP or UDP protocol convenience matching

destinationPorts.description: List of destination ports to allow 1-65535

sourcePorts.description: List of source ports to allow 1-65535, defaults to 1000-65535

v1Protocols.description: An object of all supported protocols and any attributes for them

v1UpdateNetworkPolicyResponse.description: A response from a request to update a network policy
